org.jboss.msc.service

Interface ServiceContext


  • public interface ServiceContext
    A service context can be used to add new tasks, and to create and remove services and registries. Each one of these operations is controlled by a transaction, which must belong to the same TransactionController that provided this service context, directly or indirectly.
    Author:
    David M. Lloyd, Richard Opalka, Flavia Rainone

    • Method Summary

      Methods

    • Method Detail

      • addService

        <T> ServiceBuilder<T> addService(Class<T> valueType,
                               ServiceRegistry registry,
                               ServiceName name,
                               Transaction transaction)
                             throws IllegalArgumentException,
                                    InvalidTransactionStateException
        Gets a builder which can be used to add a service to registry.
        Parameters:
        valueType - the type of the service value to be added
        registry - the target service registry where new service will be installed
        name - the service name
        transaction - the transaction
        Returns:
        the builder for the service
        Throws:
        IllegalArgumentException - if any method parameter is null or if transaction controller associated with transaction is not the same as the one associated with this service context and with registry.
        InvalidTransactionStateException - if transaction is not active.

      • addService

      • removeService

        void removeService(ServiceRegistry registry,
                 ServiceName name,
                 Transaction transaction)
                   throws IllegalArgumentException,
                          InvalidTransactionStateException
        Removes a service, causing this service to stop if it is UP.
        Parameters:
        registry - the service registry
        name - the service name
        transaction - the transaction
        Throws:
        IllegalArgumentException - if any method parameter is null or if transaction controller associated with transaction is not the same as the one associated with this service context and with registry.
        InvalidTransactionStateException - if transaction is not active.

        transaction - the transaction
